original: Fristedt, John Vilhelm, bankir, Norrköping, f. 17/11/75 i Linköp. av kronolänsm. August F. o. Anna Crona. G. 02 m. Lisa Andersson. Barn: Anna-Lisa f. 03, Maj 05. — Mog:ex. 93. Banktj :man 94-06, verkst. dir. o. ordf. i J. Fristedt A-B i Norrköp. Ordf. i styr. f. A-B Norrköp. Fören. Brygg, o. Norrköp. Apot. Mineralvattens A-B, led. av styr. f. Holmens Bruks o. Fabr. A-B, Städ. Allm. Brandstods-boll. o. försäkr :bol. Gothia o. Svithiod, led. av stadsfullm. (h) sed. 15, v. ordf. 25, ordf. 35-42, led. av Sv. stadsförb. finansråd sed. 24, v. ordf. där, ordf. i östergötl. ö. kristidsstyr. m. m. GV:sJm:t, KVOlkl, RNO, CFBGM, östergötl. ö. landst:förb. GM, Norrköp. stads S:t OlofsM.
translated: Fristedt, John Vilhelm, banker, Norrköping, born on November 17, 1875 in Linköping, son of August F. and Anna Crona. Married in 1902 to Lisa Andersson. Children: Anna-Lisa, born in 1903, and Maj, born in 1905. Divorced in 1893. Worked as a bank clerk from 1894 to 1906, then became managing director and chairman of J. Fristedt AB in Norrköping. Chairman of the board for AB Norrköping Förenade Bryggerier and Norrköping Apoteks Mineralvatten AB. Member of the board for Holmens Bruks och Fabriks AB, Städernas Allmänna Brandstodsbolag, and Göthia and Svithiod insurance companies. Member of city council from 1915, vice chairman from 1925, and chairman from 1935 to 1942. Member of the Swedish Association of City Finance Councils since 1924, vice chairman and chairman of the East Gothland Crisis Management Board, and other associations. Received the order of the Seraphim, royal knight of the Order of Vasa, commander of the Order of the North Star, commander of Dannebrogorden, and of the East Gothland county council medal. Also received the Saint Olav Medal from the city of Norrköping.
